entities: International Tribunal for the former Yugoslavia (ICTY)
International Residual Mechanism for Criminal Tribunals (Mechanism)
summary:
The Security Council, recalling previous resolutions, adopted Resolution 2306 (2016) on 6 September 2016, 
 Recalling its previous resolutions and the Transitional Arrangements set out in Annex 2 to resolution 1966 (2010), 
 The Council acting under Chapter VII of the Charter, 
1. Decides to amend the Statute of the ICTY by adding Article 13 quinquies as set out in the annex; 
 Article 13 quinquies allows for the appointment of an ad hoc judge, 
 If no permanent ICTY judge is available for the Appeals Chamber, the Secretary-General may, 
 at the President's request and after consultation with the Security Council President, 
 appoint a former ICTY or ICTR judge who is also an International Residual Mechanism judge, 
 on an ad hoc and temporary basis, 
 Terms and conditions of service to be those of an ICJ ad hoc judge. 
2. Decides to remain seized of the matter.
